title: A Patch in the Right Direction!
body:
Looking at the new PBE changes, I can say nothing more than that I am extremely proud of Riot and I hope they continue to slowly and steadily take this direction.

What I mean is there is not a single damage increase on the PBE; every champion listed has had their damage lowered, and where there is a base damage increase the ratio was subsequently lowered. This is only one patch, but I am hopeful this is a sign of Riot making an attempt to steadily creep their damage down.

Of course, if Riot slowly lowers damage it will push the champions with lower damage out of meta until all damage is lowered, but it's a small price to pay for the game to go back to its former glory.

Or it could just be me getting my hopes up, but we won't know until later.

Had to log in to upvote this. League was so much more fun when champions did less damage overall, and I honestly had way more fun in lower damage metas because team fights were more than just who deletes who faster. Damage nerfs all around, in my opinion, would let people play more champions and show more diversity in the game. Off meta picks have almost been made completely useless instead of niche, and the win condition of who does the most damage has lead to things like the ardent meta and funneling.

I agree with a few points here. The game definitely was more enjoyable when champions did less damage, but off meta picks kind of ruin the enjoyment and atmosphere of the competitive environment (the entire Ezreal support drama a few months ago, being an example). 

There are times where off meta picks work (like Sona/Taric botlane), but usually the people who come up with these off meta picks have a lot of backing, thought, and feedback behind their pick, not just "I feel like playing Vladimir jungle". 

I do, however, somewhat agree with the champion diversity statement. Metas where it's not the same 20 champions picked in competitive play every game are the greatest. Even so, it could also be argued that we're in one of the most diverse metas League has ever seen. Looking at statistics, last season all but two champions were picked at least once, which has never happened before. This season is experiencing the same diversity (I think last time I checked something like 80 champions were picked in Spring Split, which is a lot in comparison to previous seasons).

I definitely agree that I see a decent diversity of champions right now. However, champions are kind of locked into one or two builds that are required if you want to have fun at all. Sometimes people will find an off meta strategy that is strong, but in the state league is in these off meta strategies sometimes become overpowering. The ez support is a great example of this. Rather than an off meta idea being niche, it can become oppressive. When damage was much lower, I could go into a normal and play something like AP miss fortune or trist and have fun with it. I've even carried games on those two before. That doesn't happen anymore though because if you don't built the optimal path you get destroyed because there are so many champions that do way too much damage.

So yeah, since then i think that balance team is a joke, and i'll think so until this game becomes Season 4 (or 5) again.

Far from irrelevant or insignificant. 

Akali's shroud is perfectly balanced at the moment; previous shrouds were completely unfair to play against. Her winrate is at an all time low, and her pick rate is decreasing, but she's still a complete bully during the early game. These changes help reduce her early game threat. Her problem is her scaling; she has an absolutely horrible midgame and a lackluster late game. Riot will probably look into that in future patches. She will, without a doubt, be awful next patch, and I don't agree with a champion being so bad that they can't be picked, but Riot probably realizes that and will be quick to tweaking her late game.

There is nothing wrong with Karthus jungle being viable. These changes aren't to eliminate him out of being picked as a jungler, they're to prevent him from doing what he's been doing of just sitting in jungle all game and still having the highest kill participation on the team with ridiculously high damage. He seldom had to leave his jungle to gank; just hit 6 as soon as possible and pressure with R while farming to make R do more damage. This will encourage him to leave the jungle more for ganks.

Galio was allowed to be a poke support, a tank, and a hard engage support. The way you counter a poke lane is to shove the wave so they can't poke as hard; the way you counter a hard engage support is to freeze so they can't engage. But when he was able to do both, it made it very difficult to play against. If you froze, you'd get pushed into tower and poked down. If you pushed, you'd get zoned out of farming. His reduced damage will direct him into being more of an engage support than a lane bully.

Jayce is another lane bully that's getting a high pickrate right now. His Q does a ridiculous amount of damage at all phases of the game. Nerfing it was necessary to keep him viable without him being overwhelming.

Malphite is being picked as AP too frequently. These changes will encourage people to build him as a tank.

Yi's Q was mindlessly one-shotting in lower elos. This will reduce his pressure in those elos specifically.

Rammus is seeing a lot more play recently against low mobility or heavy AD teams. This is because, although he's a tank, he does a ridiculous amount of damage. A champion shouldn't be allowed to deal a significant amount of damage while building only tank. This will reduce the amount of damage he outputs.

Teemo and Wukong both needed reworks; their kits don't fit the state of the game (very outdated).

Zac was seeing the same problem as Rammus; dealing a huge lot of damage while being allowed to be tanky and have an overbearing amount of crowd control. This reduces his damage output and the amount of crowd control he's allowed to put out in a short duration. As well, Zac's ult was very clunky and a bit unfair; as well as reducing the amount of crowd control, this will keep crowd control in his kit without it being overwhelming.

Akali issue is the fact she can spam Q's while in shroud with no counterplay available unless you have a hard cc spell. The shroud should shrink as times passes by so she actually has to play with the limited time she has available.
